div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2183 Capo Soprano, c. 1955? Burial: early 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: 89 AR Messana: 4 tetradr. Syracuse: 4 tetradr. (Agathocles, Nike and trophy) Siculo-Punic: 1 tetradr. (Arethusa/horse hd.) Alexander III: 1 tetradr. (Myriandrus) Pegasi Corinth: 27 (Per. V) Anactorium: 14 Argos: 10 Leucas: 10 (incl. BMC pl. 36, 25) Metropolis: 3 (Athena on Maced. shield) Syracuse: 1 (Agathocles, full wt.) Thyrrheium: 12 Unc.: 2 (corroded) Disposition: Syracuse Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, p. 231 The coin of Dyrrhachium noted by Currò is in fact of Anactorium
